channel.title: Help with server development
channel.description:
Hello, i'm new to this part of moparscape. I am wanting to go into computer game design and I thought this would be a good place to start. I have looked through the tutorials and I really just don't understand any of them. So my question how do I get started cause I need a lot of help with this. Thank you.
...
I have another question with this one as well...
I have downloaded the moparscape client and a few of the other rar files like the new world v4 and my question is how exactly do i make it the new world v4. I have tried what i know of and still get stuck with the same old moparscape. So I need help please.
...

Homepage. >> Tutorials. >> How To Make A Server.

After Reading And Completing That. Start On Other Tutorials… Post Errors, Things You Need Help With Etc. Here.

item.title: Help with server development
item.dc:creator: @R4ND0M R4ND0M
item.description:
@R4ND0M wrote:

[quote=“Songoty, post:3, topic:170537”]If your new, you should not be using a dodian source.
Get a regular source first.[/quote]

he’s right. use a source like:
-testscape
-pimpscape
-project 16
-cheezscape

item.title: Help with server development
item.dc:creator: @R4ND0M R4ND0M
item.description:
@R4ND0M wrote:

ok, i can help. is new world a source? to check to make sure it is, go to the “runserver” or “run” bat file, and double-click. after a while it should say "starting new world on 0.0.0.0:43594.

did it say that?

heres a minitutorial…

  1. open up the source (new world v4) and select the “run” or “runserver” file; it’s sign is a cog. just double click it.

  2. wait till it says “starting new world on 0.0.0.0:#####” the “#####” is the port, it can be 5,4,or 3 numbers long.

3)k, when you see it, open up moparscape and wait for it to load. then go to file, and click on “select port” or “port”. a little box will show and you will put the port from the “run” file. most likely, the port will be 43594, but it can be 5555 or something…

  1. finally, put in your username and password, and make sure your IP says “127.0.0.1”, keep it that way. just start it and test out the server!

Read full topic
